Reviews.Title: “Not good...”
Reviews.Author: joiep_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a shock. The hotel doesn't look like a hotel for one. No other people there except the front desk person. Not so pleasing to the eyes because the lobby was dark. The furnitures were old. The luggage room was like a garbage room. We'll never go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thriving on Demand. Poor Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KartikIyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked at the last moment as I had no choice as most of the hotels in Singapore were full. This Hotel is very conveniently located in Little India near the Farrer Park MRT and is very close to Mustafa Shopping Centre. This place caters to low budget travelers from India, Bangladesh and Srilanka, who perhaps dont mind the quality of the rooms as they prefer to roam around the city, or indulge in hours of shopping and who want home like food which is available in Little India and certainly dont want to spend time in the room. The room was small and dingy. Right from the reception to the lift, the corridors and the room, there is some pungent smell that one has to get used to. The bath area is too small and the wasbasin is unclean. The total toilet and bath area put together will not be more than 5X5 feet. The linens and bedsheets were yellow and pale and less said the better. In a nutshell this place is for hardcore budget travelers who dont mind compromising on the quality of accomodation. It is for those who prefer crashing on the bed in the room instead of collapsing on the road, after a hectic day's schedule. There is so much of a demand for these kind of hotels in Little India area as tourists want ''some place'' to sleep and really do not mind the quality. When I reached there be late evening the hotel was full and by night time I saw people sleeping on the benches as it seemed that all the hotels in the vicinity were full. If there is so much demand why at all the hotel management focus on quality. Their margins are made anyways. Therefore there is no concept called as quality, customer satisfaction, cleanliness etc. In a nutshell as long as they keep the pricing low they can have 100% occupancy for 365 days and make their money. Therefore if you fall in backpacker category or you are looking at a cheap vacation this hotel can be chosen.

Reviews.Title: “If you have nowhere else to stay....”
Reviews.Author: AgataP
Reviews.Content: Located in Little India, Singapore, a budget hotel which is not that cheap, anyway. A room for three was small and dark. The towels were grey instead of white, the bathroom tiny, smelly and ...disgusting. Breakfast in the basement was horrible, with cockroaches creeping around.

Reviews.Title: “One rude hotel”
Reviews.Author: roshithaaaa
Reviews.Content: People, be ready to visit a very RUDE hotel. The receptionist was so so rude that he had not seem to be heard of hospitality at all. All the other staff does not speak even a basic English word like yes or no. Breakfast was also terrible having Wade, Patties, and Boiled eggs every day. Not clean at all. The only good thing was its location which was convenient. PS. The photos shown are different from the real place

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: agvs123
Reviews.Content: At 1st yes its cheap and has free breakfast inclusive. But check it out first because you cant eat anything in their breakfast! Its awful. Very awful I tell you. I wanted to cancel my stay but im here already. Unlucky me. So okay about service? It sucks bigtime! No cleanliness. No changing of bed sheets? Comforter? You have to call?! Is this standard?! What the hell! Plus the housekeeping people is not even nice talk of knocking and asking before entering the room. This housekeeping just knocked and entered as if we gave her permission already. There's a lot of cockroaches all over the room okay fine. But the worst part of it?!!!!!!!!! There is a freaking rat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am decided to check out! I warned you do not come here in this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have seen - a real nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Philipp K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only advantage: the hotel is close by to the MRT station Farrer Park. The rest is a nightmare and the worst I have had the worst stay of my life! Lobby (is there any? Must have missed it) has two chairs and is dirty and filthy! The elevator is old, rundown and slow. There is no sign that there is a 2nd elevator (whose condition is not better). The carpet on the hallways are dirty, smelly and seems to have never been cleaned since the hotel was opened. The whole place has an incredible stench.

Reviews.Title: “What a rat whole this hotel is!”
Reviews.Author: Dong69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is occupied almost exclusively by Indian, Pakistani and Bangladeshi nationals. The reception area is small, dirty and smelly. There is a small type of street cafe in front of the hotel which looks like a garbage dump of the hotel. the rooms are small, filthy and dirty. The towels are dirty, the bathroom are not cleaned properly, no hot water is available, the faucets are dirty and are leaking. The whole hotel smells bad and the carpet in the hallways are filthy and seem to have never been cleaned. The TV reception is not even cable and only on a few Indian speaking channels - if ever it works. The TV set's remote control is missing. The air-condition in the rooms is nosy and can either be turned on or off, there is no functioning temperature control for them. The beds are hard and are good for fakirs but not for normal people. The breakfast room in the basement of the hotel is so bad that you can't even enter it. Even the breakfast is included you will never take it cause the place is another dump! And the worst is the baggage storage room! This is a garbage dump which can not be locked with dirt stored there together with old bed sheets etc. etc. In short: Never ever enter this hotel better sleep in the streets or the MRT of Singapore they are cleaner and you get a service.

Reviews.Title: “In My personal view, this Hotel is OK! but for the maintenance..”
Reviews.Author: Ramkumar2012
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this-claremont Hotel, singapore during the month of december, 2012 with my family of four. The location is excellent, Plenty of Good Indian vegetarian hotels just opposite the Hotel, Easy access to the MRT station nearby, Taxi stand is just across the road, The breakfast of cereal and bread butter jam was ok, Good coffee. Comfortable Family room facing an excellent green ground with a large window. The bath room was just the basic, BUT the room overall just met the basic requirement of 8 hrs of night sleep essential for tourists like me. I feel this is a good hotel to stay with family in a family room with four beds. However, the property needs better upkeep and maintenanance by the Management which they seem to neglect, I hope they improve in the immediate future. If you plan your trip on your own without dependence of the hotel staff, then this hotel location is very good..A safe place to stay with family..but dont expect any extra luxury.,just the basic..B.RamKumar, India.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with good location....but with poor service”
Reviews.Author: debef7383
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights with 2 of my friends last November. We booked triplet room. It was a last minutes booking, we kind of gamble though there were lots of bad review on this hotel. Our destination is Universal Studio so the hotel has a good location, just 5 minutes walked to Farrer Park MRT, don’t have to change train. It’s right opposite of Mustafar Centre and has lot of restaurants nearby. We arrived 1 hour early for the check-in. The “unfriendly” reception welcomed us. She does even look at us when we were talking, such a bad attitude for a hotel service. A bigger surprise waiting for us in the room. When we first enter the room, we were speechless…there’s two bed, without a proper linen and the bed is so hard…not recommended to those with back problem. The toilet was so dirty especially the basin area…. And I have to pay about RM800 (USD260) for two night. Considering we had paid for the room, we decide we just bare it for 2 night. The breakfast is served at 8, so if you plan to leave the hotel earlier, you need to grab something from nearby mall the night before. It was a lesson learned for me, I should listen to the reviews….

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PP12345
Reviews.Content: I booked for 6 days and after 1 night i canceled all the rest! Totally dissapointed!!! I cant believe i pay CA$ 80/night for this hotel.. The room is all dirty. U can see it when u first came in to the hotel, the reception is horrible They even dont say "welcome and smile" at all. They looked at u like u are begged for the room! And lift is dirty and stink! and ofcourse when open the room is so dirty esp the washroom! i will never ever recomended this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient place to stay in Singapore!!!”
Reviews.Author: firozansari
Reviews.Content: this hotel proved to have a prime location in singapore bcoz of the follwing reasons: Very near to the MRT station ( Farrer park) Opposite to Singapore's only 24/7 shopping mall Near by Restaurants Good Breakfast Taxi and Bus stands just nearby

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 286RAVI_J
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this Hotel in the month of Oct 2011. The booking was made well in advance with a clear note that "I am taking chance despite of Bad reviews on the net". But, this has no impact what soever with the management. It is certainly not a hotel but a "LODGE" for the simple reason that Cleanliness is least priority (I will also blame some co-occupants for the same) and you have to be at the mercy of the staff for petty things. We stayed in family room at level4, beds were pre-occupied with "BED-BUGS" and bathroom was also stinking with bugs around the drainage area. The claim to have refrigerator in the ROOM but despite of repeated complaints no body bothered to look at it. Good part was buffet breakfast, as long as u report on time else u r left with "LEFTOVERS".Overall, I will not recommend this hotel even if you are BUDGET Traveller.

Reviews.Title: “the worst experience - ""EVER""!!”
Reviews.Author: Nestor C
Reviews.Content: I can not believe how bad this hotel is. I booked this for my wife and my mother-in-law. The room is ridiculously dirty, the washroom is so dirty and full of holes. The shower towels has hole in it. The air-conditioning keep dropping water and it looks extremely dirty. The shower.. man.. its really dirty. When I booked from expeida, i ask for 2 bed, and finally its 1 queens bed. The only good thing about this hotel is close to subway. But, I rather pay for something in downtown and just walk to every where. bottom line: I CAN NOT BELIEVE I PAID $80 for this kind of room!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is Good, that's it”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousBilly
Reviews.Content: Hotel Claremonte is located Opposite Serangoon Plaza and at 100 Meters to Ferror Park MRT station. This position is very advantegeous to the visitor who hs knowledge about Singapore and can move on own anywhere using public transport. The hotel offers breakfast that can keep you up for entire day. The choice is limited but taste is good and once you have filled your own tank, you are ready to go for the day. There are lots of indian hotels and Mustafa center ( 24 Hrs shopping mall) in 100 Mtrs vicinity and that makes it attractive. The rooms are crammped and Toilets are too small. The storage facility is inadequate. There is no wifi or any internet connectivity in the room. There is only one PC in the lobby for Internet access and it isn't free. The travellers halting Singapore for quick shopping and not fuzzy about hotel facilities can find this place suitable. There are no fans in rooms and AC does not control temparature automatically.

Reviews.Title: “God-awful.”
Reviews.Author: amygdalus
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel last May 2011. My dad said that he decided to splurge on a hotel since we were going to be staying for a while. Considering how much this hotel charged us, the experience had been absolutely horrendous. The hotel's location is convenient. It's like two somersaults away from Ferrer Park station so the taxi driver was able to locate it easily enough and the hotel has space to accommodate cars so it wasn't a hassle unloading our baggage. Across the street is a shopping mall and there are always taxis passing the area. The hotel lobby looks nice from the outside but small on the inside. There's a patio with vending machines in front where you can hang out or eat take away if you wanted. The hotel itself has a dining area in the basement where you can get free breakfast (they serve Indian food, just a heads-up for those who aren't fans). They have an elevator and an area where you can store your baggage if you can't check in yet or if you need to check out early. So, we're done with the good stuff; onward to the bad stuff. When we got to the lobby, we were drenched to the bone because it had been raining so hard. The receptionist (who looked fairly young) was eyeing us like we were messing up her precious lobby. She was unfriendly and dismissive. When we asked about activities we could do (we were told online that we could ask about tours and destinations ), she just stared at me and told me to get flyers. Plan your itinerary already because they aren't going to help you. We didn't even get a "welcome" or "enjoy your stay". We got a room on the 4th floor if I can recall correctly. The elevator is small, cramped, and rickety. It also smelled like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. When we got to the room, we were so disappointed because they looked nothing like the pictures.. The carpeted floor felt like it hadn't been vacuumed in ages, and the room smelled old and damp. The beds that they said could accommodate 4 were only for 3 people, even with the beds pushed together. The beds were also dirty (we had to brush off particles from the bedspread). The room was dusty, and small, and the AC stopped working properly after the first night. We woke up on the second day to find that our things were drenched from water dripping from the AC. They ignored our request to be transferred and didn't fix the AC after we reported it. We had to stash our things to one side of the room and catch the dripping water with a waste basket that would overflow. Room service sucks because they don't come at all when you call, and you actually have to take a trip to the lobby because our room phone was broken. The bathroom was super narrow, smelly, and disgusting. I never once stepped into that bathroom without slippers on because the floors were grimy. There is no floor partition for the shower area and the toilet, so everything gets drenched when you take a bath (no bathtubs either, if you're a fan of those). The separating door was stuck so we had to take a shower very carefully or else our things would get wet. At least the heater worked, but the water pressure was so weak and temperamental. No bathroom tissue or bidets, though thankfully the flush worked. The sink was gross and the tap hardly worked. No rods for placing wet towels nor baskets for placing bath things, just a broken shelf by the sink, and a metal shelf above the toilet that was covered in something grimy. No free shampoos or anything. No adapters, no internet (they said online that they had wi-fi, but they just had this one dinosaur of a computer that you could use for 2 SGD an hour). Breakfast is at 8 am, and I suggest you go early because there are a lot of people staying at the hotel and the basement dining area isn't big enough to seat everyone. The buffet's pretty decent and someone always comes out to refill the containers so the food never runs out, but they don't offer many selections (as previously said, only about three kinds of Indian food and some toast). They have juice and hot water is available if you want tea or coffee. The free breakfast was my favorite part of my stay here because my family and I were always able to eat a heavy breakfast before heading out. The baggage storage is terrible. It's just like a room with all sorts of things dumped in there (like broken chairs and broken frames) along with people's luggage. The room isn't even locked and anyone has access to it. You have to figure out how to fit your bags in with everyone else's because people literally just dump their things on top of one another's and then leave. Bag locks are your friends. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, ever. If I could rate Claremont any lower than 1, I totally would.

Reviews.Title: “Good view from the window”
Reviews.Author: saeedstone
Reviews.Content: Big building. Good outlook. Rooms are big enough. Big window. Bathroom amenities need renovation. The best of this hotel is its location. Shopping malls are at opposite of the road. Underground train station, bus station all are within a minute distance. See the Little India around this hotel. I got a new experience from their breakfast room at the basement. Breakfast is ok if you eat bread, butter and egg only. I felt it's rent is little bit over priced.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and recommend to budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Movarip
Reviews.Content: I read lots of adverse comments about this hotel prior making reservation, since we were 4 adults and wanted to stay in one room and they have family room with free breakfast i decided to try my luck. Our room was clean, good mattress and bedcovers, inhouse coffee/tea making facillities were provided. Bathroom amenities were very minimal, plentry of hot water available around the clock with good flow. Bath towels were old but clean and they changed daily. There was no cloth hangers in bathroom, TV was working good. Mini fridge and security box were provided. Their breakfast was good there were plenty of items made available. MRT station is just 1 minutes walk and the Mustafa Centre is just accross the road. Taxi stand in in front of the hotel and the bus stop is just 2 minutes walk only. We enjoyed our stay with Claremont Hotel and recommend to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room 804. Excellent view, Value.”
Reviews.Author: 030912v
Reviews.Content: Impressed with 24 m2 Room, great 4 poster Queen Bed. Large FlatScreen 32" TV, Drinks Fridge, wardrobe and large dressing Mirror, room for your bags. New bathroom, good shower, handbasun and toilet. Loved the view across the park Royal and evening lights made room feel large No negatives on this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!! :(”
Reviews.Author: Karthik R
Reviews.Content: The worst decision in my life i guess, is booking a room in this hotel. The photos shown on the internet are no way matching to what is present on the location! Horrible customer service. The stupid receptionists sitting in the front desk act as if we are begging from them. I WOULD NOT RECOMMENDED THIS HOTEL, EVEN TO A SWORN ENEMY OF MINE.....! IF POSSIBLE, I WOULD PREFER TO GIVE A RATING OF BELOW 1 FOR THIS CRAP CALLED "CLAREMONT HOTEL"

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Deb1Kolkata
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights during end of May'2011 booked by CLUB7. It is the most horrible hotel in terms of room, service. Bathroom was broken, A/C not working, bad smell in the corridor, u can hardly move in ur room, bed/ pillow enough bad to give strain all over the body, rusted IRON structure of the bed - stay away even if you are offered to stay free. On top of it, was rude attitude of the HOTEL MANAGER. If you ever travel by CLUB7 - categorically look for HOTEL standards - they are providing all sub standard accommodations recently.

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ani97
Reviews.Content: This is the most awful hotel I've ever stayed in, even though the breakfast was alright, the bathroom was dirty and only a foot wide, the bed sheets and towels were torn, strange kind of beds which kept toppling over, they don't even have water in the rooms and force us to drink bathroom water,the ac was not working, staff was non-cooperative, in spite off making 100's of complaints, nothing was done, the shower handle kept falling off, we had made an online reservation that they even confirmed by sending us email but still no reservation was made. Just avoid it!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!! Terrible, disgusting, horrish!”
Reviews.Author: RussellSherwood
Reviews.Content: Avoid! My PA booked this hotel on a short notice, because most other hotels were already booked. I have not had a chance to read the reviews at this point but she said it was rated 3.5-4 stars (self-rated, obviously) and I had nothing to worry about. I arrived in Little India, Singapore in the evening and was SHOKED!!! This hotel was the most neglected crap-hole I have ever seen in Singapore. I would rate it at ZERO star. Not even one! Horrish tiny dark stinky lobby with a very rude receptionist, a tiny elevator with floor board that fall apart. Continued down a very narrow corridor that smells like either human or rat urine, into a tiny, old, dusty room. I checked the toilets - they have not been properly cleaned since...probably dozen stays back, hair ball still in the drain and bits of someone's toothpaste in the sink. Someone's hair under the sheets. Disgusting stench of mould and cigarette smoke in the room, which seems to linger permanently. No matter what I did with the air-con, the smell was just getting worse and becoming unbearable. I could not stay there longer then 5 minutes. Took my staff and ran out to a Tandoory restaurant across the road which had a free wi-fi to book a different hotel. I asked for a refund - Claremont refused and failed to answer to any of my emails. called a few times later they were just hanging up. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND AVOID THIS NIGHTMARE DUMP! DISGUSTING, DIRTY OLD PLACE WITH RUDE PIGS AS STAFF!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY BASIC AND SMALL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: CALLINGYOU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and small infant.The bed was very small for two adults and 1 infant.The breakfast was same for three days.They don't have a restaurant.The only advantage with this hotel is it is very near to mustafa(just opposite)and mtr station is very near(5mins walk).If u r on tight budget than u can try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pathetic ........”
Reviews.Author: tonymumbai
Reviews.Content: pathetic hotel...dirty...cockroaches in bathroom...also found cockroaches on breads in breakfast...very poorly maintained property...worst hotel ever stayed at...

Reviews.Title: “The stuff of nightmares- don't go by the Internet pics”
Reviews.Author: Aisquash
Reviews.Content: There is only one thing about this hotel worse than the hotel itself- me not finding time till today to write this review earlier. I should have written this even before checking out of Claremont Hotel! Sincere apologies to those who would have avoided staying there since my stay by reading my review. Anyway, here we go. Before I begin the descriptive review, a bit about how it makes one feel. I am about 40 years of age, and at the peak of my career in which I have struggled to get where I am. I usually stay at Golden Landmark village when in Singapore. But for once, I impulsively decided to go for a budget hotel. The one good thing Claremont did for me is to remind me of my struggling days 20 years back, when I used to save every penny where I could. Hotels with small rooms with antique TVs, smelly carpets, musty grills indicating there might be an air conditioner behind them, washrooms that would easily make one prefer constipation than a visit to answer nature's call etc. Thanks to Claremont, I am back on earth from the 7th cloud, and my faith and devotion in God reposed- I hope he keeps me well paid enough to never return to my struggling days. The hotel. Almost forgot that amidst my nostalgia and prayers! The signboard above the hotel doesn't work, and the taxi drivers don't know where it is (unusual in Singapore, probably an offense), so be prepared to look for it. It is opposite Mustafa shopping center, by the way. The reception is worth less of a mention than the receptionist, who flatly refused the refund of advance tariff paid on the internet booking. I asked for the refund just by seeing the reception. Then the rickety lift to the room- I used it only once, and subsequently preferred the stairs to the 5th floor (I'm quite fit, actually). I did not quite want to be lifted to heaven yet- I'm only 40, remember? The room- oh no. I went down to the reception and pleaded for another room- the best they had, even at extra cost. Giving credit where due, I have to say she obliged promptly, without a smile. The next room did not have a smelly, wet carpet, and only the mixer/tap of the shower was missing in the bathroom, so I was overjoyed. After all, it was only a 1 night stay. I showered by sitting under the tap and turning about- luckily, I'm also reasonably flexible. If you are a gymnast or limbo skater, this style of taking a shower won't even bother you at all. Well, I slept. No bug bites. The complementary breakfast was in a basement we usually use for stowing trash/discarded items. The breakfast had an incredible choice (incredible as in the scary movie- 'The Incredible Melting Man', 1977)- instant noodles, bread (toaster is provided), jam, and Tang. There were other dishes I could not decipher- probably South Indian. There are some restaurants nearby. This hotel will suit that shady business traveler who will try to save a few quids at the cost of his comfort and happiness- another S$50/- will get you a hotel worth calling a hotel. Surprisingly, there were quite a few guests there. S$50/- can get a nice gift for your beloved from Mustafa! I will happily transfer 500 Airline miles to anyone who can tell me why the strict Singapore government has not demolished this hotel yet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality Showed At Claremont Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Raja1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Claremont Hotel in Singapore During the First week of June 2010 along with my aprents for 5 days. We enjoyed our stay and hospitality shown by Hotel Staff. It is very clsoe to Mustaffa shopping centre and has easy acess to Metro. Overall we had a very ncie time. Food was good too... We will surely stay there in our next visit to Singapore later this year.

Reviews.Title: “MOST DISGUISTING HOTEL YOU COULD IMAGINE”
Reviews.Author: zeebug
Reviews.Content: We were booked in for three nights. The pictures on expedia.com looked good enough and was rated a 3 so we thought we would stay there. When we got there the lobby was dirty and we were hoping the rooms were going to be a bit cleaner. We went upstairs and the hallway stunk and was a dirty mess. We entered our room and it was shocking. every inch of the room was filthy. the floor was dirty, the windows and mirrors had finger marks all over them, the walls were dirty, the sheets and duvet cover was stained and dirty, the bathroom looked like it had never been cleaned in its life. As soon as we checked in we went online and booked another hotel and then went back to the hotel and talked to the receptionist. We said we couldn't stay here anymore and we were checking out now, and asked if we could get a refund. she said as we had already checked in, we couldn't be refunded for the first night (although it had only been 2 hours since we checked in), and that she would email expedia and say that we were not staying there anymore. As we had had enough and I was near hysterical we caught a taxi and went to our next hotel. When we got home, we rang expedia to try get our refund. There had been no email from the receptionist and expedia had tried ringing them at least 10 times with no answer, to confirm our refund. we are still waiting for refund.. I WOULDN'T SEND MY WORST ENEMY HERE LET ALONE A DOG TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL. NOT EVEN A BACKPACKER WOULD WANT TO STAY HERE. IT IS A NEGATIVE 5 STAR HOTEL. EWWWWWW

Reviews.Title: “It was our worst experience of ever staying in a hotel anywhere in the world.”
Reviews.Author: achoz
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Expedia.com, we had the worst possible experience ever of staying in a hotel outside of the US. We have never encountered a hotel as horrible as The Claremont Hotel anywhere on this planet - my wife and I have traveled 5 different continents that include even the most depleted areas of Sub-Sahara Africa. The Hotel has broken furniture, stressed out air-conditioning with dust literally spitting out of the air vents, sandy floors (yes, one could feel the sand on the wooden floors), roaches all over the place, no hot water for showering, broken faucets, beds that basically rocked - the list is endlessly. I even took pictures of this dump. Btw, the pictures on the hotel website are a blatant lie. Do not trust them. The staff including the manager, Adam, have a terrible attitude. He thinks that he is running a bloody A++ establishment! This wretched place should be de-listed from all travel websites. Expedia is misguiding travelers. Granted that this is a budget hotel, it does not, however, even meet the minimum standards of a hotel. It is, in fact a safety hazard. Please people, do not ever trust Expedia or book a room in The Claremont even for a single night!

Reviews.Title: “small and secluded in busy Little India”
Reviews.Author: gautammasand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for less than a day.Had extended my Singapore trip by a day and couldnt extend City Hub, as was unfortunately fully sold out, so shacked up at the Claremont, with my colleague who was staying here since a week... It is 2 minutes walk to Farrer Park MRT and in Little India, where most of my potential clients were, which were the plus points Checked in around 1 pm afternoon and rested fro an hour and went out for sightseeing and returned late evening....room was small and a bit cramped, but the A/C was quite effective and a respite from the Singapore heat....shower had good running cold and hot water too, yet quite small.....took some rest late evening and went out for some work and then proceeded to the Airport to take my flight back home.... Didnt stay the night at Claremont......

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: devendraa
Reviews.Content: A reasonable value for money hotel located very clse to the Metro Rail and opposite the Mustafa Market which is a shoppers paradise. Hotel serves you good breakfast. Location is the key with many Indian restaurants very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled by any eventual good review - stay away from this hell!”
Reviews.Author: Luis082
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it's a dirty, unpleasant, low grade mockery offering nothing. The staff is very ruddy, the breakfast is awful - I believe the dog would not eat anything from the food offered and out of the dirty and half broken plates, the rooms and bathrooms are dirty, the whole building has a terrible smell, the people who stay there are noisy, screaming out at any time of the night, slamming doors and moving furniture. No-one cares about your complaints.....at the end if the price was only 10 USD per night it would be too expensive for this rotten hole! My sincere advice – STAY AWAY !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for a Decent Budget at Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunilsurana
Reviews.Content: While I was looking for a budget hotel at the best and convenient location,my friend booked this room for me and I was only skeptical about this place till I reached there.Once there, I realised everything is pretty decent for the money we pay since comparatively this is one of the hotels which is cheaper for travellers like me.No high expectations post I read reviews from this website but it proved to be wrong and I was happy to have chosen this place.This is in Little India, Right opposite to Mustafa, right next to the MRT,Very Very good for Indian food(Veg and Non Veg).Rooms are decent for the budget we are looking at since I explored many other hotels and everything was equal or expensive and nothin was as close as this is to Little India.Breakfast is ok but there are many options when you jus step out of the hotel.Overall value for money and a decent hotel.Would always recommend people like me who spend hours together to browse and get some details and want to book randomly.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad - and we came from rural Sabah.”
Reviews.Author: lucass_10
Reviews.Content: This is my first and possibly only review of a hotel my family and I have stayed at. I felt compelled to put into writing just how bad this hotel is. In fact - the most amazing thing about this hotel is that there are apparently 15 hotel that are even worse! We will give anything a go having lived in India and travelled with the kids through most of south east Asia. We came to the Claremont from a fairly rough hotel in Lahad Datu, Sabah. it would appear that the people that run the hotel either do not own a broom or have no idea how to use it. There are tiles falling off the exterior and interior of the hotel, all manner of junk piled up in the fire escape (we used it after getting sick of waiting for the lift), the place stank, the bathroom was straight from Faulty Towers and this place is not really that cheap. If this place was the last hotel available in Singapore I would stay in JB. Give this one a miss. I have no doubt the few positive reviews of this place are by the owners.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL FOR TOURISTS WITH ECONOMY BUDGET”
Reviews.Author: niraj1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel’s main plus point is its location. It is situated in Little India area just opposite the great Mustafa market. The Ferrer Park MRT station is also just a few seconds away. Indian food is available in nearby restaurants. Hotel’s morning breakfast is fresh and warm. Though you have a very limited choice. But hotel’s service is very poor - including reception, room service and maintenance service. Hotel’s cleanliness is also not good. You may easily spot insects inside your room. Overall it is a hotel for the tourists with economy budget and also for the Indians who starve for Indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible- nightmare experience”
Reviews.Author: harishbala
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I didnt go with high expectations but was still shocked. The terrible stench when you enter the room is enough to know what else to expect. Wallpaper is peeling off everywhere, AC vent leaking, carpet full of dirt, bed hard as a rock, crappy TV with no remote, phone keeps ringing. You can really feel bed bugs in this hotel. Coming to the bathroom... the tap at the water basin had no handle at all.. and when somehow you are able to get water out of it, it is not fixed properly. The bathtub is a mess, not fixed properly and no hot water. I did not even dare to see how breakfast was as I didnt want to consume anything from this terrible place. Did not sleep even for one minute. I wish I had never been there and would advise you not to go there unless your only option was to sleep on the roadside.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and leaking .. worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: TerrificTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Claremont Hotel included poor amenities, lack of service, incompetent reception staff and a room with many items needing repairs. We have stayed in budget hotels and backpackers so are not always looking for luxury - just a clean room and bathroom and helpful staff. The Claremont had none of those things. We were originally given a tiny room on the 3rd floor but due to renovations with a strong paint smell in the corridor I asked to move. We were moved to the 7th floor to a larger room but the phone didn't work, the bathroom light didn't work, the TV had a horrible hum on most channels, there was no mini bar - not that we needed one but there were dire warnings on the checkin sheet if you didn't tell the reception staff things were missing. And the window opened - isn't that illegal to have a window open on the 7th floor? When it rained the window leaked so badly that we had a pool of water on the floor that we had to mop up with the bath mat. The bathroom basin also leaked so we had to put the rubbish bin under that. The room wasn't serviced at all in the time we were there. The first day we were just getting up and about when the cleaners came through so we asked them to come back but they were determined they had to do something so they empied the rubbish bins. That was it for the two days. Coffee and tea making - they only provided packets of coffee and tea with milk powder added so we bought our own coffee and tea bags. And as for breakfast - we didn't bother. Just a visit to the basement was enough to put us off eating there. Twice people barged into the room because the receptionist had given them our room number instead of the floor below. That was interesting - especially as one time I was wandering round in my undies ... not a good look! Reception were useless. All requests were met with indifference and when I mentioned the light and phone for the second time they just said - tomorrow, tomorrow. At one stage I had to resort to ringing reception from my mobile in the room because a friend was coming to pick us up and she had tried to contact us but the receptionist just kept telling her our phone was busy. When I went downstairs to talk to her she was either on Facebook or chatting on her iPhone. Helpful - not! The final straw was the last day when my friend wasn't feeling too good so we requested a late checkout due to our late flight home and was told it would cost $50. I mentioned the leaks, lights etc and was directed to "Miss Debbie" who when I said about the lights and phone wanted to know when we'd reported it ... which time? I replied. ! So she gets on her mobile to call up maintenance and says she'll send someone up immediately. I said that wouldn't very helpful because my friend was asleep and not felling well. She was adamant and sure enough in about 10 minutes we had these two blokes come into the room and move the bed trying to fix the phone line. She did charge us $25 for the extra hours. I couldn't be bothered arguing - it was like talking to a brick wall. In fact she didn't even have the social skills to talk to me about the price but just yelled at the receptionist - "it will be $25 for these people for the late check out." It was disappointing end to a great holiday but you live and learn. In hindsight we should have walked out when given the first room and gone to the Park Royal up the road!

Reviews.Title: “pretty and wellcoming”
Reviews.Author: saritasbluewin
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is buffet style. I would like more fruits & some western flavours like yoghurt & breads. Could improve on staff mannerism especially upon checking in a welcoming smile would have been great especially to the weary traveller. All in all it is a good average hotel for travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “My one of best experiences of staying at claremont hotel in singapore.”
Reviews.Author: duncan513
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, good service, clean and cozy room that i was experienced at claremont hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: pchop2006
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping (Mustaffa Shopping Centre 24/7) . Convenient locations for all types of cuisine. Value for money & easy access to all areas of Singapore.Great location !!!! Public train is only seconds away. Staff helpful and are keen to make your stay a pleasant one. There is the odd unpleasantries but overall staff are friendly & willing to go the extra mile . Very homely atmosphere where you won't find the same in other "cold' hotels. Newly refurbished and has all modern fittings. A good assortment of breakfast foods catering to travellers from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Location of hotel for indian travellers is very good”
Reviews.Author: anil43
Reviews.Content: Booked two double bedded rooms for S$80 each (breakfast included) for 5 nights 4 days. Great view from window. Rooms were very small but were provided with basic amenities like tea coffee maker, fridge and TV. Small bathrooms.Breakfast with lot of variety especially for vegetarians like us. courteous staff. very well connected with metro . Just opposite Mustafa mall. Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Every Experienced”
Reviews.Author: MalikMurad
Reviews.Content: We were three families from Pakistan and checked in this hotel on June 24th for two nights only. Since we were looking for a budget hotel, we thought this would be atleast acceptable. BUT for our surprize this was the WORST HOTEL EVER. The receptionist was VERY RUDE. The breakfast was not good at all. However, the location was good as this hotel is just opposite to Mustafa Centre and other Little India Market. We asked for an extra pillow and bed-sheet only and to our surprize they refused to give us these basic supplies. The receptionist was extremely un-courteous as she was answering in NO everytime. We had three rooms for three families. Unfortunately one room was pathetic as the wash-basin was broken, shower was not working, hot water for shower was not available. The check-out was s smooth as the receptionist just took the keys and even didn’t bother to say goodbye or thanks etc. Rooms were very very very small. Overall this was not a good hotel just due to the uncurious attitude from the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but NO Service from hotel”
Reviews.Author: MehulNandu
Reviews.Content: It was a short business trip to Singapore for the first time.I tried many but didnt get a Room as being a Holiday Season so thought of staying in this hotel.When on check-in COunter Staff had no Idea of whether rooms are available or NO & Absolutely no Servie inspite several reminders.Dont have a Coffee Shop or a Restaurant where people can order something...Dont ever stay in this Hotel...Only thing Good was that The Lady Manager was a good Woman who helped me getting to directions

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine such hotel exists at Singapore Was shocked the moment we entered room"”
Reviews.Author: dare_traveller
Reviews.Content: We were two couples fron Jamshedpur, India booked at this hotel for 3 nights. Check in at reception was quick (discounting the passive response from the receptionist). Alloted room at 4th floor. Lift interior was lacking proper (any) upkeep. Once we entered the room ....it was shock of my life...a foul smell, dust laden carpet, all furnitures were dull for want of cleaning, bunch of hair on carpet, chair, bed sheet. I was clearly a case of extremely poor house keeping for long time. Toilet/ Bath ( already too small) was wet all around ..as if some has used it before we checked in..the wash basin was dirty. We had to run down several times to get the house keeping girl .. only with a small broom to remove the bunch of hairs. We struggled with the rude staffs for hours.. left the room open for 2 hours to freshen it..We called operations manager who was another dud with all his justification that u are in abudget hotel..he was rude, shouting , even told us u can find out another hotel and shift. Our request that we are only concerned about the minimum hygene was not getting into his head. Finally we moved around in that area looking at rooms ( same rental) and got one at Jalan Besar Road "Hotel Classique" and we shifted there. K N Jha.

Reviews.Title: “An ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: VikramHercop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days, we booked this hotel through our agent in India as Park Royal was full. It always happens in this time of the year that the best of the hotels in this area gets booked because of the Indian vacation. You can find many Indian tourists in this area "Little India" because most of the Indian famous restaurants are located here. This hotel is another example known to deceive guests which posts pictures of luxurious looking rooms on the internet. The hotel has nothing great to talk about, its just average sized rooms with normal maintenance, however it cannot be termed bad.The hotel is located very close to the Farrer Park metro station.The morning breakfast is pretty good. But the staff show very little attention to the guests. For example: While having breakfast you ask the staff for ketchup, you can be 100% sure that you will not get it in your first attempt, then on your second attempt they give you a look as though you are staying there for free before you get what you want.So I will give a perfect 0 to this hotel for service. With all factors put together this hotel is over priced, which is a premium for staying next to a shopping mall 'Mustafa'. I surely would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Instead of paying 110 USD a night in this hotel, you can get better hotels in the Orchard area, which is a bigger shopping hub.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING”
Reviews.Author: georgeonholiday
Reviews.Content: 12 countries and numerous hotels and at last I have found the worst hotel in the world. This hotel offers nothing. Stay away Stay away. Rude staff, bad service, bad housekeeping, bad food, bad everything. The only saving grace is the location for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Visit for Hell Experience”
Reviews.Author: sanjoe7
Reviews.Content: I went for my Honeymoon and booked Claremont HOtel in Singapore, but the place was a hell. The Staff was most unfriendly, no one was attending to room service calls there were bugs in the bed n u can get an idea why that was not a hell

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: medicolegal1
Reviews.Content: This is the most disgusting hotel that i have ever been to. The staff are rude and very unhelpful. The place smells, the A/C didnt work whilst we were there. We stayed at the Park Royal Hotel for 8 nights and wanted to extend by another night but as hotel fully booked, we had to look for another one. When we arrived,I went into this tiny lobby to ask if Icould have anyone to help me with our luggage. The reception was full with other guests who were waiting for their rooms to be ready.I was bluntly told that 'this is a budget hotel,we don't have such things here'. I booked and paid for a TRIPLE SUPERIOR room, and on the website, the pictures showed three beds, and a beautiful bathroom. The room we got(I was told that was indeed, triple superior) was a small dingy room.ONE room, not even a double bedroom size with a double bed, and sheets which were an apology for white. The carpet and wood on the floor had water marks and smelt musty, and we soon found out that drops of water came down from the ceiling from the airconditioning grate, but it did not work. the fridge was in a cabinet on which stood a very rudimentary TV, and the doors could not be closed and were tied together with some pink ribbon.The fridge was empty, and on it was a notice that items in the fridge would have to be paid for.On the cabinet itself, there was a stream of little ants playing tag. . There were cockroaches and the room was so DISGUSTING. It was filthy, beddings had'nt been changed, there were ants in the room and the shower did not work. The metal fittings of the shower head and pipe were green with rust.There were two towels in the bathroom, which looked as though they'd been reused and recycled to within an inch of their cotton lives,and had an aversion to bleach,they were so offwhite it was not funny.My 4 year old son turned to me and said, 'Daddy can we go to the other place!' We were so disappointed that we left after a few hours. PLEASE STEER CLEAR OF THIS HOTEL AS YOUR HOLIDAYS WILL BE RUINED. Its not worth it even if you are given the room for free. The singapore tourist board MUST BE NOTIFIED of this appalling place; calling it a hotel is an affront to honest decent travellers!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: varshvila
Reviews.Content: Paid 10% towards advance booking. But while checking out, Hotel charged again full amount without 10% deduction. Lost my camera in room. Worst hotel in my 14years of roaming all around the world. Bad hygeine.

Reviews.Title: “Hub of Singapore city”
Reviews.Author: SaifAlam
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through our travel agent who was bent on not giving us this hotel because of its poor reviews from their other travellers,but we insisted due to its proximity to the mrt and the famous Mustafa mall. The service at the reception was not the best one as we had to wait at their lobby till they took time for us to check in. The room was quite decent and was clean and quite habitable,we were surprised at what we were told of by our agents. Mustafa mall was just across the road and had its 24hr forex counter offering the best rates in Singapore,better than any bank rates at the airport. The mrt was very close and had us connected throughout the city. The morning breakfast was a little sad as the food,did not contain any fruits. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends who want just basic amenities with a tight budget in hand. Saif Alam India

Reviews.Title: “An average stay”
Reviews.Author: SG69
Reviews.Content: It was an average hotel with poor service. The ambience was not great either. The food was average. The only plus point was its location opposite to the 'Mustafa Mall', the biggest mall , in singapore. There was an electronic safe provided in the cupboard to keep important documents etc., but it is too risky to keep the important belongings in it as it may get locked and may not open until you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful. Should have trusted the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieWirral
Reviews.Content: Was only looking for stopover for one night. Read reviews - but looked at photos and thought it must be exaggerated. Wrong..... In fairness, the room had a safe, airconditioning, comfortable bed, shower that worked fine, television - basically all that we needed for a one night stay. BUT...... the hotel itself, corrididors, general decor etc was appalling. Paper off walls, damp, and although the room adequate - just about - the walls and curtains etc all needed a good scrub. The breakfast room had a dreadful smell on the approach, and is not geared at all to europeans. Was happy with the bread, eggs and jam - but a toaster would have made all the difference. The staff at reception were not overly helpful - but the hotel did seem to be very full, (although I don't understand why). We had only paid £36 a room (get what you pay for comes to mind....). However - a couple of days before I thought at that price it would be a good idea to book another night even though we were flying at midnight, just for convenience. We didn't do it because the costs were coming up at £90 per night - I would have been fuming it I'd paid that. As it turned out this hotel couldn't offer late check out so walked round corner - to equally poor hotel following day - and booked in there to just enable us to dump cases for the day and have shower at end of day. AS we were a party of four this worked out fine. However - our friends room at Clarmont was larger than ours - but dirtier - the cobwebs were hanging profusely around the room. It served purpose as a one night stop over - but I would not really recommend it at all. Also - not just this hotel - but with the kettle provided, packets of all in one coffee drink provided - ie dried coffee, milk and sugar - not the best for those of us who drink black coffee, no sugar.. Just including as info for other like coffee drinkers - as I do tend to carry small jar of coffee with me anyway - just in case........

Reviews.Title: “A pit of dispair!!!”
Reviews.Author: KIMRICHES3
Reviews.Content: BE AWARE!!!! - This is far worse than just a hole! DIRTY/ HOSTILE place where there is no single spot of what you would call exceptable. Planted bang smack in the roughest parts of Singapore. Full of illegal imigrants, green card holders. They say that Singapore is the safest place to be, well it isn't. This hotel is also a brothel and loaded with all kinds of delights such as insects galore, crumbling building interiors and stains everywhere. The rooms are tiny, run down, stained holes. We viewed three and all were beyond discusting! There is a lovely park next door filled with tramps and boxes. This is where the local rats and cockroached like to hang out. PLEASE do not go here, it will ruin your holiday! ALSO - The pictures on the sites are not of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWARE AT ALL COSTS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: visamaster011
Reviews.Content: this is by far THE WORST PLACE I HAVE EVER STAYED AT!!!! for the price that they require you would expect a decent place which is clean n well maintained.. but the reality of this place is anything than that!! the wallpapers are all peeling off and the walls are all leaking!!! the bathrooms are in horrible condition with things broken everywhere and disgusting leakage marks with stained walls and peeling wall papers all over. the fridge welcomes guests with EXPIRED chocolates ( which will be charged for by the way if we consume them!!!) when u call the front desk for any assistance, they either dont attend the call or they say there is no one to attend to you at this point of time, so wait till tomorrow. at night, there is no one at the at the front desk and there is no light in the entrance!! u feel like you are entering some forbidden haunted place! the females who work in this hotel are also extremely rude and incompetent to be doing the work that friendly and helpful people should be doing. i have no idea what the management is doing with all the money that the guests are paying for this place! NEVER GO HERE PLEASE!

Reviews.Title: “Near to Mustafa and Cheap but ppor hygiene”
Reviews.Author: samirgala
Reviews.Content: I had booked one Family Room at Claremont Hotel from July 11 2009 to July 14 2009 for my holidays in Singapore with my family. The reason i had booked this hotel was due to its proximity to Mustafa (just bang opposite) and Litte India and also because it was cheap. However some one who has a elite preference should not expect much from this hotel. You will find cockroaches in good nos, bathtubs in Bathrooms leaking, no house keeping etc. However due to its proximity and because of low price i would recommend this hotel to Budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mukul_2u
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel comfortable. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Co-operative staff. Good breakfast for vegetarians. Excellent location opposite the famous 24 hour open Mustaffa Store. Good option for budget Indian traveller

Reviews.Title: “Most dirtiest and worst service holel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: Kalpage
Reviews.Content: The website pictures and the actual hotel are are so far apart its not funny. The service is so poor that it would be a goos case study for poor custmoer service. The rooms were dirty and under the bed was beer cans drunk by the previous occupant. Cockaroachs a plenty and whilst I was in the room the pest controller walked in and sprayed the room. Did not evan bother to ask me if OK. The time I checked in could not give me a card to get to my room. The recption would come up and open the door. Because I had prepaid hung in there. If was with family would have left the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Jkt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute before finding out later about mostly bad reviews about this hotel...so we didn't expect much from our stay there. Anyway we only use the room for sleep at night. When we checked in at around 9pm, the front desk has a sign BE BACK in 5 minutes, and the lady there checked us in without any trouble, except we didn't get our reserved family room but we got 2 queen sized bed rooms without any additional costs. The room itself was ok but they really need some work on the carpets and getting rid of the cockroaches.... the breakfast was surprisingly ok with toasts, chicken nuggets, sausages and stuffs. But on the second day, when we were there at 9:30 am the breakfast has finished!! overall, it's ok as a budget hotel, location wise is good (just across mustafa). The management needs to do something serious to the hygiene issues though...

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand why so many bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Karthik2388
Reviews.Content: We - a group of 5 friends (all guys and all Bangaloreans) - stayed here for 2 days. We'd reserved a family room from their website without checking out reviews first, so naturally we became very apprehensive after reading these reviews and ratings. They'd told us early checkin was possible but not guaranteed - it depended on room availability. So we'd also made plan Bs - like taking shower in one of the Changi Airport lounges. We landed in Singapore early morning around 7 AM and called them up from the airport. Luckily a family room was available, allowing us early check-in. The hotel is just 1 road away from Ferrer Park MRT station on the NE line. We reached the hotel comfortably and checked out the room. They charged SGD50 for early check-in, but gave us breakfast for all 5 people inspite of early check-in. Breakfast was a typical American breakfast with some local touches like chicken samosa (which was rather rubbery but edible). All in all, acceptable for the 4 veggies in our group too. If you want to stick to Indian food, there's a good restaurant (Komala) just across the road. Mustafa Shopping Centre is right across the hotel. Our room was on the 7th floor. Nothing particularly bad about it actually. Since we were on a hurried trip of 2 days, we wouldn't be spending much time in the hotel room anyways. After reading so many bad reviews, my guess is that the family rooms are a better deal than other room types. Room has electric kettle and tea powder to make tea. Only 2 electric sockets were there (one for TV, the other one free) and none were near the beds. Hot showers and bath was available in the bathroom. Info for the fussy ones: sofas were a bit stained. TV remote was not working. The bath tub was supported by tiles, so a standing shower was a bit of a balancing act. Beds are quite comfortable. One friend did complain of some biting, but the remaining 4 of us felt nothing and woke up just fine with all organs intact, so no worries there. AC was slightly noisy. Next day, we checked-out by noon but our departure from Singapore was only at 7 PM evening. So the hotel's free baggage room proved useful for us. However, it's a common store room and anybody's allowed access, so be careful if you're keeping something valuable in there. Overall, I'd say it's no Hyatt :D but then again, you're paying just SGD 183 (133 in case no early check-in) for a family room; for that price, it's not a bad room. It's a perfectly fine hotel if you just want to sleep and keep luggage somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Smitha_82
Reviews.Content: Hotel Claremont, one of the worst hotel i ever stayed. The host at the hotel are worse and i get no words to describe their response towards their guest. They do not know how to talk to guest, forget about anything else. Morning breakfast is very bad and i can tell you even a beggar will not like it. They have AC rooms, but the best part is the AC does not work at all and its suffocating. We go on a holiday to relax, but then when you finally land there you are not relaxing but you feel like running away from there. On the whole I would say, it is really sick... the people, service, everything over there is sick... Anyone planning for a trip to Singapore, please dont stay in Hotel Claremont.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Bad facilities”
Reviews.Author: sats81
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife decided on this hotel as it was close to little india. The desicion was also prompted by the fact that i had stayed in this hotel earlier in 2006. but we were in for a lot of surprises this time around. At the time of booking itself i had requested for a early check in and was assured that the room would be ready for occupation by 9.00 am but inspite of reaaching the hotel around 9.30 the room was not alloted to us till 11.00 am.that apart while making a deposit towards the room their credit card machine broke down and i wasnt provided with a chargeslip copy though the transaction was approved.it took three days of reminding the front office staff in order the set things straight.worse still while checking out four days later the credit card machine was not fixed and i was forced to pay by cash. This apart the room was okay. but the were some small cockroaches in the bathroom. overall it was a bad experience considering the fact that we were paying US$ 100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic service”
Reviews.Author: Rach1809
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in last August but wasnt too impressed with the service. Firstly, when I reached the hotel, the cab driver couldnt find the lobby. I have to get down at the back only to realise later they dont have a lobby. Then, I had to wait 30 mins for my room to get ready at the reception. Room sizes are small. Only good thing about the hotel is cheap rates and host of food options located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !”
Reviews.Author: sunnytv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly avoidable on a trip to Singapore. To begin with the its painful to begin a holiday with a grumpy miserable rude lady in the reception whose monosyllable replies goes like 'no idea' dont know', (ok two syllable to give her some credit for her effort). She behaves as though she is offering alms to beggars. The hotel is an eye sore with the most dingy reception that I have ever seen. The hotel looks shady, dark and is conjested beyond words. The room is superficially neat, but has cockroaches lurking under the beds and bed bugs waiting for you to sleep. The room service is pathetic and best left unsaid. They have some thing which can be called breakfast that is served in the morning. This include left over fried rice from the previous night, chicken nuggets (dry and stale) and samosas. They also serve boiled eggs and bread with jam. The food is tasteless and old and it is better to go out and pay some money and eat in some hotel across the road. I can go on and on but Its enough to say that the hotel doesnt look anything like what they show you in their website. For the money they charge please pay some 50$ extra and get a room in some real good hotel. (This hotel is not the cheapest in Singapore but will be among the worst there). I wonder whether there is any regulatory board in Singapore which looks at these kind of things, where they fleece you offering world class room and end up giving you the worst possible possible room. This hotel runs I think mainly on the bookings by tour operators which cater to budget families from India. Thye dont care a damn about you visiting them again because they know you will never do so . They will have the next lot of families dumped into their hotel by some crook tour operator from India. Please choose some other hotel... dont fall for some 20 -30 $ difference from other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Do Your Self a Favour and Forget this Dive”
Reviews.Author: Vatsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 missirable days. No Exaust fan in bathroom so toilet smell went into room and steam from shower when we finaly got hot water connected,water from shower went on to floor tile no matter what you did and tiles extremily slippery bathtub moves when you get in to have a shower no shower screen .Room smelt very musty beds as hard as concrete only one sheet on bed even after asking for a top sheet. No room safe, fridge very dirty had to clean before use furnishings very dated. We had a Family room 2 adults and 2 children.This was in what they called a refurbished room and we were the first people to use it I would hate to think what there old rooms are like. Do Not Stay here Rating 1/2 Star If i put my dog in there for a stay the RSPCA would have me arrested and charged for animal cruality. This place is in little India and sleeping in the Slums of Deli would be Better. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav29
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel..... Good rooms... No Termites or stuff... Awesome service.....in case of any sort of inconvenience they even provide you with much better extra rooms good arrangement for breakfast Awesome location. Very cooperative and understanding manager!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a nightmare !”
Reviews.Author: kiranindia
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend Hotel Claremont, even to my enemies. The photos on the website looks good but when you actually end up there a lot of surprises waiting for you. •AC does not work – NO problem, manageable •Water Drips out of AC window – NO problem, manageable •Carpets are dirty and smelling – NO problem, manageable •TV does not work – NO problem, manageable •Coffee maker does not work – NO problem, manageable But worst thing there are bugs and insects in the Bed which suck blood. Whenever I complained the management changed Rooms. Finally in 3 days I changes 5 rooms, but could not sleep in any of them – finally ended up with Allergy. Kiran

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Galore”
Reviews.Author: RaviInBangalore
Reviews.Content: We knew while booking it was a budget hotel ( but $ 80/night on the "wired-destinations" web site), but I did not know that I had to pay in blood for staying there. I am on a dose of anti-histamine as I write this mail, because of the bed bugs in the hotel. Just tending my rashes all over my body from the bites. My friends who were also given rooms in the same floor ( 5th Floor) had to have thier rooms changed twice even to get some decent sleep. To make it worse, nobody answers when you call reception from the rooms, but you go down yourself and you see the front desk staff engaged in gossip, who will feign ignorance at everything. When I mentioned her these problems, she also told me that she has never seen any of the rooms in her life and that they were not allowed to the lodging area as a policy. However, if you want to stay there, be ready for the bed bugs. If you do not have a choice, ask for rooms in the lower floors, where my friends say it was better than the 5th floor rooms. My contact info Ravi Shankar . Email: ravi@merlinhawk.com

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: dc1410
Reviews.Content: It's terrible and horrible hotel. The room is disgusting. Insects and bugs found in the room and toilet. The walls is full with insects and bugs blood, I believe someone killed it and left the blood stain. Human hair and pubic hair was found on the bedsheet and toilet when I check-in the room. The breakfast is terrible and I do notice small/baby croaches crawling on the buffet breakfast table. I had made booking online and paid deposit. By rite the deposit should be deducted from the hotel bill when I check out. However the hotel said that "no such thing". The deposit I paid when I book online is for online booking service fees and could not be deducted from the hotel bill. I do not want to quarrel with the hotel as I wanna get out from the hotel as fast as possible. Online Hotel Agent should remove this hotel from your selection. If the owner read this review, you could check the reservation confirmation number: 2245859849. As for others take my advise and please don't stay here if not you will regret.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - Claremont Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctang2
Reviews.Content: I just had the worst experience staying in a budget hotel. Had a 4-nite online reservation for a family room in this hotel. Did not expect much as it was a budget hotel.However, what I experienced is far below what I expected. On arrival, we were told that there were some problems with the air conditioning system of the family room. Therefore, they will be relocated to another hotel called Aspinal, which is 5 minutes walk away. We were made to wait approximately 30-40 minutes before the shuttle arrived to transfer us over. Arriving in Aspinal, we were made to wait for another ~30 minutes before getting our keys to the room. The room in this hotel is simply dirty. The whole floor was damp (i'm not sure where did the water come from), no carpet, wooden flooring and this made the room smelly. One side of the bed is broken and is merely being supported by a wooden stick. Upon pulling up the blanket, i discovered that the bedsheet only covered half of the bed. The other half is left uncovered!!!!! The lights were dim and the paint on the wall was peeling. When I requested for a room change at the reception, the receptionist inform me that there were no other rooms available in a couldn't-be-bothered attitide. He wasn't helpful to mend the situation. In the end, I had to request for towels to be put on the wet floor. That was the first night. On the second day, i requested to be transfered back to Claremont hotel due to the terrible room condition in Aspinal. Receptionist in Aspinal was rude. Acted as if she is doing be a favour for a place to stay. She informed me that the room will be ready in Claremont at 10-->10:30 am. There were no shuttle to transfer us back to Claremont. It was drizzling and I had to drag all the luggages all the way back. Upon arriving the room was not ready. Apparently they were not inform. So we had to wait for another 30 minutes before we could check in. The room is not as dirty and smelly as compared to Aspinal. However, the ceiling in the corridor to the room was leaking. And there were pails along the corridor for the leak! There were also cockroaches in the room. And I suspect that there were bed bugs as my friend had a lot of red dots on their skin after staying there. Definitely not a recommended hotel. Stay elsewhere, DO NOT STAY HERE --> CLAREMONT HOTEL 1) Rude staff 2) Room is dirty, smelly 3) Breakfast is lousy

Reviews.Title: “Hate It!!!”
Reviews.Author: dr_steph
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there.. The rooms were not yet ready, but it is stated in our reservation form that we will arrive at 330 pm.. We waited for almost an hour. when we entered our room, the bedsheets, blanket and pillowcases were really dirty, u can see stain marks (of i don't know what). When we entered the toilet, my gosh! I don't know what smell is that.. but it really is not appealing! It smelled like wet towels that were not dried out properly! The next morning, we tried out their breakfast, it was simple and ok but when we saw roaches we freaked out.. oh, did i mention the bath towels? They were really dirty with bugs there.. my aunties got the towels with bed bugs in it.. the tissue paper, was really dirty. I had to run down to Mustafa to buy new paper towels to use. Oh, when we complained, the front desk personnel was really rude! Many tourists complained to the Sinagporean tourism board and we were asking them to call their manager, and they kept on saying she was on her way only to find out, she already went to Malaysia. Many people really complained at the front desk including us. Don't stay here.. yes its cheap, but its still not worth ur money..

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter-sf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days as I could not find another vacation hotel besides 5 star hotels which cost S$400-500 a nite. thanks to the convention going on. The first nite was not as bad as I hardly got any sleep due to jetlag. Second nite was horrible, got up in the middle of the nite and found out that I had rashes all over my body. Frustated, I went to mustafa and got some soothing oitment for myself and lots of repellent for the bed bugs. In the coming days, my rashes soared and i finally decided to see a doctor. Besides the bed bugs, room stinks, bathroom has an obnoxious odour and the shower water seeps through the walls dirtying the carpet. Their breakfast room looks like a prisoner's cell and the food is no good either. Breakfast consists of boiled eggs and noodles along with bread and butter. I would never recommend anyone to stay in this hotel; even if its cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disaapointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Vachas
Reviews.Content: The staff is rude-they think they are doing u a favor by giving rooms to stay.The breakfast is horrid.The rooms are like Pigeon Holes.The only good think about it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “terrible place, terrible staff, horror treatment -not wirth staying at all.”
Reviews.Author: AR R
Reviews.Content: I had reserved the room at claremont hotel thro web site, paid advance too, and they confirmed the room. On reaching the hotel exactly as per the schedule, the hotel reception staff( most rude in whole hotel industry) said no room-this after 8 hours of flight. After several requests and showing the confirmation and advance paid, he directs you to go to their other hotel aspinal, which is 5 to 7 mins. walk--with a heavy luggage, you feel walking this dist. is miles. That too the staff say, as if -if you want go -other wise forget it--attitude- The staff very poor trained, most unfit for a service industry, rude and they feel they doing the customer a favour by giving a room. I will never be recomending this hotel or aspinal to any one. Added is lousy room , cleanliness and they won't even take an intl. call and make a note and give to us when we are away. LOUSY PLACE. NOT WORTH IT AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Administrative staff -Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a room in this hotel(Jun10th,2006). Showed up on time. I was told that the room was being cleaned and it would take a few minutes to get the room ready. Checked with the reception every 15 minutes-same response - 'the room was still being cleaned'. No manager on-site. Lousy hotel. Horrible ambience. Waited for 2 hours at the reception -lost patience and left. Very terrible administrative staff. Don't book even if it is the last place on earth. Waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “An Easily Accessible Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meiji
Reviews.Content: I booked into Claremont Hotel because of two things--first, the rate is cheap and second, it is near an MRT station (Farrer Park Station). My companion and I were fully aware that it is a budget hotel and so we did not expect much. We were going to stay there mostly in the evenings and we intended it to be a place to rest and sleep after a long day of sight-seeing and shopping in Singapore. I booked a triple room and we were given a room with 1 double bed and 1 single bed. I had expected it to be 2 twin beds and a fold-away mat because that was what was written in my booking confirmation. So the double bed and the single bed was a welcome surprise. The room is spacious enough for us to move around and it uses a key-card lock. It has a big window that open up to a vacant lawn space at the back of the hotel. We had unobstructed views of other buildings from afar. Apart from the usual small fridge and TV that comes with almost every hotel room, there are also an electric kettle, mugs, glasses, spoons, tea, coffee, and sugar sachets. The beds are just the right size for us (we are about 5 feet 4 inches tall) and so for anyone taller, I can imagine some difficulties in adjusting to the length of the beds. The aircon takes a little while to cool the room, maybe 20 to 30 minutes. The aircon vents have rusts and need cleaning. There is a lingering but tolerable musky odor in the bathroom. Once you have showered and used some fragrant shampoo, the odor disappears. We are provided with clean towels for each day we stayed there. Hand soap in a dispenser is provided near the sink. Body wash soap, also in a dispenser, is also provided in the shower stall. A roll of tissue is also provided. However, there are no toothpaste, toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner, shave, and other toiletries one might expect. Fortunately, we came prepared in the event that these things are not provided so we brought our own. The shower stall is narrow but it fits us just right and so, again, just like the case of the bed, for anyone bigger or taller, I can imagine some difficulties in taking a shower. Breakfast is from 8AM to 10:30AM. It is a buffet breakfast and it is at the basement of the hotel. There are tea, coffee, and sugar sachets, butter and bread which can be toasted using the toaster provided, juice, cereals, milk, noodles, rice, empanada, soup, and eggs. On our first morning, we came down at about 5 minutes before 10AM and had expected little food left. We were glad though when we saw still plenty of food instead. The entrance to the Farrer Park MRT stations is just a leisurely 1.5-minute walk from the hotel. The actual location of the trains is about 3 minutes away from the entrance. The hotel is facing the Serangoon Road where many cars and buses pass by. On the other side of the road, infront of the hotel is the Serangoon Plaza. Most taxi drivers are not familiar with the hotel name and so it helps to mention the Serangoon Plaza, which is well-known in Little India, as a landmark. There is also a taxi stand infront of Serangoon Plaza. We had an early flight back home so when we checked out, it was about 4:30 in the morning. We were able to hail a taxi in less than 30 seconds and it took just about 15 minutes to reach the airport. It also took us about 15 minutes to reach the hotel from the airport. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is budget conscious and looking for an easily accessible place and would not be staying in the hotel the whole day. One can not really place their standards so high for a budget hotel like this. Just expect the barest minimum and be happy with the extra perks that come along.

HotelInfo.Name: Claremont Hotel Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 301 Serangoon Road | Little India, Singapore 218224, Singapore
